description: Full gap analysis: "How are analytical insights effectively communicated from sports data analysts to coaches and athletes, what factors influence adoption and comprehension, and what communication strategies maximize performance impact?"
question: How are analytical insights effectively communicated from sports data analysts to coaches and athletes, what factors influence adoption and comprehension, and what communication strategies maximize performance impact?
confidence_explanation: Based on 15 directly relevant papers. 15 papers - limited base; No full-text access; Many papers 2025-2026

landscape.summary: Analysis of 15 papers on analytics communication to coaches and athletes. Dominated by qualitative case studies (47%). Very few experimental designs (<10%). No validated measurement instruments.

key_findings.finding: Coach-Analyst Relationship is Critical for Analytics Adoption

methodology_profile.summary: Dominated by qualitative case studies (47%). Very few experimental designs (<10%). No validated measurement instruments.

key_papers.title: Exploring rugby coaches perception and implementation of performance analytics
key_papers.contribution: First qualitative exploration of coach-analyst relationship dynamics.

key_papers.title: Football coaches perceptions of decision-making: A multi-method study
key_papers.contribution: How coaches integrate performance data into tactical decisions.

key_papers.title: A Department of Methodology: A feasible framework to integrate multidisciplinary support teams
Impact of sports analytics systems on athlete experience
key_papers.contribution: Analytics monitoring effects on athlete perceptions.

key_papers.title: AI-enabled learning analytics use relates to physical literacy and engagement
key_papers.contribution: AI-driven personalized feedback and athlete engagement.

gaps.title: Comparative effectiveness of data visualization approaches for coach comprehension
gaps.description: No experimental studies compare visualization formats on coach comprehension, trust, and usage.
gaps.suggested_approach: RCT with coaches assigned to different visualization conditions.

gaps.title: How athletes understand, interpret, and autonomously use performance analytics
gaps.description: Almost all research is coach-focused. Athlete data literacy unexplored.

gaps.title: Optimal timing of analytics feedback in training-competition cycle
gaps.description: No studies manipulate feedback timing systematically.

gaps.title: Communication skills that distinguish effective sports data analysts
Variation in communication strategies across sports and cultures
gaps.description: Most research European football/rugby. Generalizability unknown.

gaps.title: Does improved analytics communication actually improve performance?
gaps.description: Most studies measure perceptions, not performance outcomes.

gaps.title: AI-driven vs human analyst analytics delivery effectiveness
gaps.description: Unclear whether automated insights match human interpretation.
gaps.suggested_approach: Experimental comparison of AI-only, human-only, hybrid.

gaps.title: Optimal organizational design for analytics integration
gaps.description: No validated frameworks for organizational design.

gaps.title: Optimal volume and prioritization to avoid cognitive overload
gaps.description: Coaches report data overload. No research on optimal volume.

gaps.title: Interactive dialogue vs one-way data delivery

research_agenda.title: Visualization format effectiveness experiment
research_agenda.description: Which visualization maximizes coach comprehension?. Methodology: RCT with 60-90 coaches, 3 conditions. Data: Performance dataset, coach sample.

research_agenda.title: Athlete data literacy intervention study
research_agenda.description: Does data literacy training improve athlete analytics use?. Methodology: Pre-post intervention, 40-60 athletes. Data: Athlete cohort, wearable systems.

research_agenda.title: Analyst communication competency model
research_agenda.description: What competencies distinguish effective analysts?. Methodology: Observation + interviews + framework. Data: Access to sports organizations.

research_agenda.title: Real-time vs delayed feedback timing study
research_agenda.description: Halftime analytics vs next-day analysis outcomes?. Methodology: Quasi-experimental, 4-6 teams, full season. Data: Video + performance data.

research_agenda.title: Organizational analytics structures comparison
research_agenda.description: Which org model produces best knowledge translation?. Methodology: Multiple case study, 6 organizations. Data: Access to 6 organizations.

assumptions: Papers found via platform API represent current database coverage
database_coverage_gaps: Sports psychology feedback literature may be missing
what_would_improve_this: Full-text access to the 15 core papers
self_reflection.process_cost_reflection: Agent-contributed analysis. No direct API cost to platform.
